H0.text: Gravity on the Moon is greater because it is closer to the Sun, as the statement that best compares gravity on the Moon to gravity on Earth.

H1.text: Gravity on the Moon is less than gravity on Earth because the Moon is smaller than Earth.

H2.text: Gravity on the Moon is less because it has less atmosphere than the Earth.

H3.text: Gravity on the Moon is greater because it has less mass than the Earth is the statement that best compares gravity on the Moon to gravity on Earth.

A4.text: The acceleration due to gravity on the Moon is 1.625 m/sÂ², which is approximately 16.6% of Earth's gravitational acceleration.

A5.text: The Moon's gravitational parameter (GM) is 1/81.3 of Earth's, indicating that the Moon has significantly less mass than Earth.

A6.text: The Moon's diameter is 3,474 km (2,159 mi), roughly one-quarter of Earth's (about as wide as the contiguous United States).
